alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 5:26PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY LAKE EFFECT SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF JEFFERSON...OSWEGO...AND LEWIS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy lake effect snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of lake snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 524 PM EST, the northern edge of the lake effect snow band extends from Watertown to Philadelphia across Jefferson County. The southern edge of the band has shifted a bit to the south and extends from Pulaski in Oswego county to Croghan in Lewis county. This lake band will continue to drift slowly south through early this evening. Additional lighter snow is occurring across the rest of the area. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Watertown, Sandy Island Beach State Park, Fort Drum, Stony Point, Carthage, Lowville, Pulaski, West Carthage, Adams, Glen Park, Herrings, Selkirk Shores State Park, Adams Center, Southwick Beach State Park, Henderson Harbor, Barnes Corners, Richland, Denmark, New Bremen, and Watson. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 35 and 47. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. && TIME...MOT...LOC 2220Z 228DEG 199KT 4400 7569
